messages: c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:24): ok, how the hell do i rig this: http://www.gods-inc.de/barbie/3d/gun2.png ?
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (04:28): I don't think I could explain it.  But I have some free time so I could make an example mesh for you to dissect.
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:30): that with the unable to explain seems to be the common thing about blender rigs
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (04:31): dissecting armatures is the only way to learn it. I've found
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (04:32): Especially when it comes to contraints
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:32): heck, by the timei wasted trying to understand armatures i can rig that thing up with empties
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:34): thx, just a low poly concept
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:37): delirus: its part of this: http://www.gods-inc.de/barbie/3d/endeavor.png
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (04:43): alright.  mind if I email it?  DCC has never been kind to me
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (04:45): what you need for things like turrets is the locked track constraint
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:45): yeah, figure that, but didn't got it to work
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (04:46): okie, lemme see if i can figure it out :)
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (05:02): ah crud, not working, you don't allow connections in
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (05:03): bleh, I think it's my router
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (05:04): in your irc lcient, set dcc to use only a range of ports, like 5000-5010, then in your router, fireewall allow incoming tcp on those ports
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (05:08): my brain can't wrap around it right now :|
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (05:09): maybe one day the mail will get here :)
